00002 
00003 #include <cstring>
00004 #include <iostream>
00005 
00006 using namespace NET;
00007 
00008 int main()
00009 {
00010     static char send_msg[] = "The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog";
00011     static char recv_msg[sizeof(send_msg)];
00012     static size_t len = sizeof(send_msg);
00013 
00014     try {
00015 
00016     // Test peer status on a connected UDP socket
00017     UDPSocket peer_socket;
00018     peer_socket.connect( "127.0.0.1", 65001);
00019     if( peer_socket.peerDisconnected()) return 1;
00020     peer_socket.send( "", 1); // ok, no icmp received yet
00021     peer_socket.send( "", 1); // icmp received, send fails
00022     if( !peer_socket.peerDisconnected()) return 1;
00023 
00024     // Test UDP specific calls
00025     UDPSocket send_socket;
00026     UDPSocket recv_socket;
00027     send_socket.bind(47776);
00028     recv_socket.bind(47777);
00029     std::string source;
00030     unsigned short port = 0;
00031 
00032     send_socket.sendTo( send_msg, len, "127.0.0.1", 47777);
00033     recv_socket.receiveFrom( recv_msg, len, source, port);
00034 
00035     if( port != 47776) return 1;
00036     if( source != "127.0.0.1") return 1;
00037     if( recv_socket.timedReceiveFrom( recv_msg, len, source, port, 10) != 0) return 1;
00038 
00039     // source must not be changed
00040     if( port != 47776) return 1;
00041     if( source != "127.0.0.1") return 1;
00042     if( std::memcmp( send_msg, recv_msg, len) < 0) return 1;
00043     std::memset( recv_msg, 0, len);
00044 
00045     // Test multicast
00046     send_socket.setMulticastTTL(0);
00047     send_socket.connect( "224.40.0.1", 47777);
00048     recv_socket.joinGroup("224.40.0.1");
00049     send_socket.send( send_msg, len);
00050     recv_socket.receive( recv_msg, len);
00051 
00052     if( std::memcmp( send_msg, recv_msg, len) < 0) return 1;
00053     std::memset( recv_msg, 0, len);
00054 
00055     recv_socket.leaveGroup("224.40.0.1");
00056     send_socket.send( send_msg, len);
00057 
00058     if( recv_socket.timedReceive( recv_msg, len, 0) != 0) return 1;
00059 
00060     // no errors in this testcase
00061     } catch( const SocketException& e)
00062     {
00063         std::cerr << e.what() << std::endl;
00064         std::cerr << e.errorCode() << std::endl;
00065         return 1;
00066     }
00067 }
